message: Studs is an annual project for the Computer Science programme at the Royal Institute of Technology. The goal is to create a platform for interaction between students and their possible employers, by arranging cooperative events.  The project also is a course, earning the students 15 credits. The course is evaluated with a written report, summarizing the entire project. Towards the end of the project, the members of Studs goes on a trip together, with the goal of enabling cultural and professional exchange.

Studs is an annual nonprofit project conducted by students of the Royal Institute of Technology in Stockholm (KTH). The project is run by 30 hand-picked engineering students, all in their master’s degree within the field of computer science. By arranging events together with companies, we provide both the students and their possible employers with valuable time together.

TThroughout the year the project members will meet companies for events, typically taking place in the companies’ offices. This is an opportunity for the students to gain insights into the company and its business. Studs’ skilled event group helps the companies to customize the events according to their wishes, which ensures events as unique as the companies behind them.

Towards the end of the project, the members of Studs goes on a trip together. The purpose of the trip is enabling a cultural and professional exchange for the students. The journey is planned by the projects’ travel group with the goal to visit cities with unique tech scenes and opportunities both in startups and more established actors.
If you're interested in having an event with us, or you're curious and want to know more – contact Cristian
